ARTICLE D. VILLAGE ADMINISTRATOR
SECTION:
1-8D-1: Creation Of Office; Appointment
1-8D-2: Removal
1-8D-3: General Duties; Bond
1-8D-1: CREATION OF OFFICE; APPOINTMENT:
There is hereby created the office of village administrator for the village.
The village administrator shall be appointed by the village president with the
advice and consent of the village board for a term not to exceed the term of
the village president. (For the purpose of definition the "village board" is
defined as consisting of the president and board of trustees.) He shall be
chosen for his executive and administrative qualifications with special
reference to his actual experience in or his knowledge of accepted practice in
respect to the duties of his office, hereinafter set forth. He need not be a
resident of the village. No board member shall receive such appointment while
he is serving in that capacity. The village administrator shall receive such
compensation as the village board shall fix from time to time by ordinance or
resolution. (Ord. 2001-28, 5-7-2001)
1-8D-2: REMOVAL:
Unless otherwise specifically designated, the village administrator's
appointment shall be an annual appointment along with other village officers.
The village administrator shall be subject to removal from office during the
term of his or her appointment as provided in 65 Illinois Compiled Statutes 5/
3.1-35-10. If he or she is terminated by the village for any reason other than
removal pursuant to 65 Illinois Compiled Statutes 5/3.1-35-10, he or she shall
be paid a sum of money equal to his or her then current salary for a ninety
(90) day period plus an amount of money necessary to keep his or her insurance
benefits in existence for ninety (90) days subsequent to his or her
termination. This sum shall be reduced by any deductions required by law.
Notwithstanding the foregoing, the village may enter into an employment
agreement with a village administrator, provided that:
   A.   The agreement must be terminable by the village at the end of the term
of the president in office at the time of the agreement;
   B.   The agreement may provide for severance compensation of up to six (6)
months if the village administrator is removed or not reappointed; and
   C.   The terms of the agreement shall supersede the provisions of this
section. (Ord. 2014-03, 2-25-2014)
1-8D-3: GENERAL DUTIES; BOND:
The village administrator shall be the chief administrative officer of the
village, under the direction of the village president, who is the chief
executive officer. He may head one or more departments and shall be responsible
to the village president and the village board of trustees for the proper
administration of all affairs of the village, excepting, however, the affairs
or matters as the president and board of trustees may from time to time
determine shall be under their direct control and supervision. All provisions
herein contained shall be subject to the exceptions set forth in the
immediately preceding sentence. To the ends hereinbefore contemplated, but
subject to the exceptions and qualifications hereinbefore set forth, the
village administrator shall have power and shall be required to: (Ord. 2001-28,
5-7-2001)
   A.   Dismiss any hired employee of the village when in the best interests of
the village, accompanied by notification to the president and board of trustees
of the action taken and reasons therefor.
   B.   Recommend to the president and board of trustees the appointment,
suspension or removal of the following appointed officers: treasurer, chief of
police, chief of the fire department, building commissioner, coordinator of the
emergency management agency. (Ord. 2015-29, 5-26-2015)
   C.   Coordinate and oversee the annual budget process so that the budget can
be presented to the village board and so that the budget can be properly
administered after its adoption.
   D.   Direct preparation by the treasurer at the end of the fiscal year of a
complete report of village finances and preparation of annual report on
administrative activities for the prior fiscal year.
   E.   Supervise reporting to the Village Board of the financial condition and
financial needs of the Village and make recommendations as may be deemed to be
desirable. (Ord. 2008-02, 1-22-2008)
   F.   Recommend to the Village Board a standard schedule of pay for each
appointive office and position in the Village service, including minimum,
intermediate and maximum rates.
   G.   Recommend to the Village Board, from time to time, adoption of such
measures as he may deem necessary or expedient for the health, safety or
welfare of the community or for the improvement of administrative services.
   H.   Recommend to the Board of Trustees the creating, consolidating and
combining of offices, positions, departments or units of the administrative and
executive departments of the Village.
   I.   Attend all meetings of the Village Board unless excused therefrom and
take part in the discussion of all matters coming before the Board. He shall be
entitled to notice of all regular and special meetings of the Board. (Ord.
2001-28, 5-7-2001)
   J.   Supervise the purchase of all materials, supplies and equipment for
which funds are provided in the budget; enter into contracts necessary for
operation or maintenance of Village services for amounts in accordance with
Village ordinances and the Purchasing Policy. (Ord. 2017-22, 6-27-2017)
   K.   See that all laws and ordinances are duly enforced.
   L.   Investigate the affairs of any department or division under his
jurisdiction, all complaints in relation to matters under his jurisdiction
concerning the administration of the government of the Village and in regard to
service maintained by the public utilities in the Village, and see that all
franchises, permits, and privileges granted by the Village are faithfully
observed.
   M.   Devote his entire time to the discharge of his official duties.
   N.   Perform such other duties as may be required by the Village Board, not
inconsistent with this Code. (Ord. 2001-28, 5-7-2001)
   O.   In case of accident, disaster or other circumstances creating a public
emergency, the Village Administrator may award contracts and make purchases for
the purpose of meeting said emergency for amounts up to and including twenty
thousand dollars ($20,000.00), but he shall promptly file with the Village
Board a certificate showing such emergency and the necessity for such action,
together with an itemized account for all expenditures. If an emergency exists,
and if the Corporate Authorities of the Village are unable to hold a meeting to
authorize appropriate expenditures to respond to the emergency, the Village
Administrator and the Mayor are authorized to approve expenditures over twenty
thousand dollars ($20,000.00). Thereafter, at the earliest opportunity, all
such expenditures will be submitted to the Corporate Authorities for their
approval. All emergency purchases must be thoroughly documented. (Ord. 2014-35,
11-25-2014)
   P.   The Village Administrator shall furnish a surety bond in the amount of
one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000.00) to be approved by the Village Board,
said bond to be conditioned on the faithful performance of his duties. The
premium of the bond shall be paid by the Village. (Ord. 2001-28, 5-7-2001)
ARTICLE E. DIRECTOR OF PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT
SECTION:
1-8E-1: Creation Of Office; Appointment
1-8E-2: General Duties
1-8E-1: CREATION OF OFFICE; APPOINTMENT:
   There is hereby created the office of village Director of Community and
Economic Development. The village Director of Community and Economic
Development shall be a hired position. He shall be chosen for his execution and
administrative qualifications with special reference to his actual experience
in or his knowledge of accepted practice in respect to the duties of his office
hereinafter set forth. He need not be a resident of the village. No board
member shall receive such appointment while he is serving in that capacity. The
village Director of Community and Economic Development shall receive such
compensation as the village board shall fix from time to time by ordinance or
resolution.
(Ord. 2007-31, 6-26-2007; amd. Ord. 2025-16, 5-13-2025)
1-8E-2: GENERAL DUTIES:
   The village Director of Community and Economic Development shall be the head
of the Building Department and shall perform responsible administrative work in
surveying, promoting, fostering and advising the village of Fox Lake and
various segments of the business community as to ways and means to foster,
maintain and promote the economic, commercial and industrial development of the
village. The village director of Community and Economic development shall
report to the Village Administrator or his or her designee on matters relating
to the economic conditions of the village and shall coordinate the activity of
economic development. To the ends hereinbefore contemplated, but subject to the
exceptions and qualifications hereinbefore set forth, the village Director of
Community and Economic Development shall have the power and shall be required
to:
   A.   Develop a business prospect list of businesses to occupy available
commercial and industrial space.
   B.   Develop a list of properties available for commercial and industrial
development.
   C.   Develop a cooperative working relationship with the local chamber of
commerce and the economic development corporation.
   D.   Develop close communication with the Illinois Department of Commerce
and Economic Opportunity, Illinois Retail Merchant Association and various
trade associations to keep abreast of new development programs in economic
development.
   E.   Develop a relationship with local and out of area commercial brokers
for the purpose of establishing services of future prospects for Fox Lake
business sites.
   F.   Respond to local citizens inquiring about community development,
planning and zoning regulations and ordinances.
   G.   Oversee the development and implementation of the Community & Economic
Development Department goals, objectives, policies and priorities.
   H.   Provide guidance to the Building Commissioner regarding the
administration of the Zoning Ordinance, Comprehensive Land Use Plan, Sign
Ordinance, State Statutes, and other adopted plans and Building codes as
needed.
   I.   Maintain up-to-date knowledge of TIF and BDD requirements and outside
agency regulations. Oversee adoption of updated construction codes and permit
fees when necessary.
   J.   Prepare and present recommendations to the Planning and Zoning
Commission, Economic Development Strategic Planning Team, and all other
applicable commissions or committees to the Board of Trustees. Oversee the
preparation of the agenda, packets and information dissemination to the
Planning and Zoning Commission, Economic Development Strategic Planning Team,
and all other applicable commissions or committees to the Board of Trustees.
   K.   Coordinate development/redevelopment projects in conjunction with
commercial developers, property owners, Planning & Zoning Commission, Board of
Trustees and other involved parties.
   L.   Assist developers regarding submission requirements and development
standards; coordinates plan review functions across multiple departments to
ensure compliance with appropriate codes and ordinances.
   M.   Prepare annual building department budget; identify and prioritize
operational needs; supervise expenditure of allocated funds.
   N.   Prepare applications for federal, state and other grants or supervise
staff engaged in the preparation of such applications.
   O.   Supervise all staff members in the Community & Economic Development
Department; administer annual performance evaluations of department employees;
establish performance standards for the department.
   P.   Provide staff assistance to the Board of Trustees, Village
Administrator, Planning and Zoning Commission, and other applicable committees
or commissions; prepare and present staff reports and other necessary
correspondences.
   Q.   Perform such other duties as may be required by the village board, not
inconsistent with this code.
(Ord. 2007-31, 6-26-2007; amd Ord. 2025-16, 5-13-2025)
ARTICLE F. COMMUNITY LIAISON
(Rep. by Ord. 2015-29, 5-26-2015)
ARTICLE G. BUDGET OFFICER
SECTION:
1-8G-1: Creation Of Office; Appointment
1-8G-2: Powers And Duties
1-8G-1: CREATION OF OFFICE; APPOINTMENT:
   A.   There is hereby created the position of budget officer in the village
of Fox Lake, who shall be designated by the mayor with the approval of the
village board.
   B.   The budget officer may hold another appointed municipal office, and may
receive the compensation established from time to time by the mayor and village
board of the village for both offices. Such budget officer shall serve at the
pleasure of the mayor.
   C.   Before entering upon the duties of this office, the budget officer
shall take oath and post bond as provided by statute.
   D.   Unless otherwise specifically provided herein, the term "budget
officer" shall be deemed to be synonymous with "finance director". (Ord. 2014-
36, 11-25-2014)
1-8G-2: POWERS AND DUTIES:
The budget officer shall have the following powers and duties:
   A.   To permit, encourage, and establish the efficient planning, budgeting,
auditing, reporting, accounting, and other fiscal management procedures in all
municipal departments, commissions, and boards;
   B.   To compile an annual budget in accordance with subsection
1-10-4A of this title;
   C.   To examine all books and records of all village departments,
commissions, and boards which relate to monies received and paid out by the
village, its departments, commissions, and boards and debts and accounts
receivable, amounts owed by or to the village, its departments, commissions,
and boards;
   D.   To obtain such additional information from the village, its
departments, commissions, and boards as may be useful for purposes of compiling
a municipal budget, such information to be furnished by the village, its
departments, commissions, and boards in the form required by the budget
officer; and
   E.   To establish and maintain such procedures as shall ensure that no
expenditures are made by the village, its departments, commissions, or boards
except as authorized by the budget. (Ord. 2014-36, 11-25-2014)

1-9-1: POLICE DEPARTMENT:
1-9-1-1: CREATED:
There is hereby created a Police Department of the Village, which shall consist
of a Chief of Police and such other members as the Board of Trustees may from
time to time prescribe. (Ord. 78-35, 11-6-1978)
1-9-1-2: CHIEF OF POLICE:
   A.   Appointment: The Chief of Police shall be appointed by the Village
President, by and with the advice and consent of the Board of Trustees. He
shall also be the Village Marshal. The Chief of Police shall be the Chief
Administrative Officer of the Police Department and shall answer directly to
the Village Administrator, and the Village Administrator shall share the
information received with the Village President. (Ord. 2015-53, 12-8-2015; amd.
Ord. 2017-23, 5-9-2017)
   B.   Duties 1 : He shall be in charge of the Police Department and all
members thereof shall be subject to his orders. He may make rules for the
functioning of the Police Department subject to the Village President and Board
of Trustees' approval. He shall keep such records and make such reports of the
department as may be required by statute or ordinance. Furthermore, the Chief
of Police must investigate any incidents which may require discipline of
members of the department promptly, and must notify the Village Administrator
of any such incidents within twenty four (24) hours of the incident. The Chief
of Police shall impose discipline or decline to impose discipline only after
consultation with the Village Administrator. (Ord. 2015-29, 5-26-2015)
   C.   Compensation: The compensation of the Chief of Police and members of
the department shall be established by the President and Board of Trustees.
(Ord. 80-7, 2-18-1980)
   D.   Inability To Serve: In the event the Chief of Police is unable to act
or incapacitated, is out of town, or there is a vacancy in the Office of the
Chief of Police, whether by illness or disability, the Deputy Chief shall act
as supervising officer to perform all the duties of the Chief of Police and
shall be the Chief Administrative Officer of the Police Department until a new
Chief of Police has been appointed and confirmed in accordance with the
requirements of this section. (Ord. 2002-35, 6-11-2002)
 
Notes
1 1. See also subsection 1-4-4B of this title.
1-9-1-3: MEMBERS OF DEPARTMENT; CHAIN OF COMMAND:
   A.   Ranks Of Police Department: In addition to the Chief of Police, there
are established in the Police Department the following ranks:
      1.   Deputy Chief, which shall be a position of exempt rank, and who
shall be appointed by the Chief of Police from persons of the rank of
patrolman, currently in a full time position.
      2.   Lieutenants, Sergeants and patrolmen in such numbers as the
Corporate Authorities shall determine appropriate and who shall be appointed by
the Board of Fire and Police Commissioners. From the persons of the rank of
patrolman, currently in a full time position and above, the Chief of Police may
appoint as exempt rank the following:
         a.   Support Services Commander to direct and supervise all civilian
personnel assigned to the Records Division.
         b.   Investigations Commander to direct the training and operations of
the Investigations Division.
         c.   Commander of Patrol to direct the operations of the Patrol
Division.
      3.   Such Record Department personnel as the Corporate Authorities shall
determine necessary and who shall be hired by and answer to the Chief of
Police, or his designee.
   B.   Employment With The Police Department As A Full Time Police Officer:
The members of the Police Department shall be appointed or employed as follows:
      1.   Applications of prospective applicants shall be filed with the Board
of Fire and Police Commissioners (the "board") on forms to be provided by said
board. Applications must be filed with the board prior to taking any
examination required by the board.
      2.   All applicants shall comply with rules and regulations promulgated
by the board pursuant to powers granted said board in 65 Illinois Compiled
Statutes 5/10-2.1-1 et seq.
      3.   The applicant shall then be subject to the medical, physical and
psychological tests and any other tests to be performed by the Board of Fire
and Police Commissioners pursuant to the powers granted said board in 65
Illinois Compiled Statutes 5/10-2.1-1 et seq., and the rules and regulations
promulgated thereby. (Ord. 2013-09, 4-23-2013)
      4.   Upon completion of the medical, physical and psychological tests
performed by the Board of Fire and Police Commissioners, the Board of Fire and
Police Commissioners will prepare an eligibility list which will be made
available to the Village Administrator and Chief of Police together with a
written certification from the Police Pension Board that the applicant is
eligible for acceptance into the Fox Lake Police Pension Fund. (Ord. 2013-09,
4-23-2013; amd. Ord. 2017-23, 5-9-2017)
      5.   The applicant shall also be fingerprinted and a background
investigation of each applicant shall be conducted.
      6.   No applicant shall be employed as a regular member of the Fox Lake
Police Department until all of the following conditions are first satisfied:
         a.   The applicant must have successfully satisfied all of the tests
and requirements of the board of fire and police commissioners;
         b.   The applicant must have been determined eligible for acceptance
into the Fox Lake police pension fund;
         c.   The applicant must have successfully passed a drug test. Each
applicant shall be required to submit to an analysis at a qualified independent
laboratory designated by the board of fire and police commissioners for the
purpose of determining the employee's use of controlled or prohibited
substances.
      7.   Command authority shall be in descending order according to rank and
in the event that there are on duty two (2) or more of equal rank, the officer
having the longest term of service with the department shall be deemed the
supervising officer unless the chief of police designates otherwise.
   C.   Part Time Police Officers:
      1.   Definitions: The following definitions shall apply in this
subsection C:
   BOARD: The Illinois law enforcement training standards board.
   PART TIME POLICE OFFICER: A law enforcement officer who has completed his or
her probationary period and is employed on a part time basis as a law
enforcement officer by a participating unit of local government.
   POLICE TRAINING SCHOOL: Any school located within the state of Illinois,
whether privately or publicly owned, which offers a course in police training
and has been approved by the board in accordance with the Illinois police
training act 1  and the rules and requirements of the ILETSB.
   PROBATIONARY PART TIME POLICE OFFICER: A recruit part time law enforcement
officer required to successfully complete initial minimum part time training
requirements to be eligible for employment on a part time basis as a local law
enforcement officer.
      2.   Certificate Required; Waiver: A person hired to serve as a part time
police officer must obtain from the board a certificate: a) attesting to his or
her successful completion of the part time police training course; b) attesting
to his or her satisfactory completion of a training program of similar content
and number of hours that has been found acceptable by the board under the
provisions of the Illinois police training act; or c) attesting to the board's
determination that the part time police training course is unnecessary because
of the person's extensive prior law enforcement experience. A person hired on
or after January 1, 1996, must obtain the certificate within eighteen (18)
months after the date of hire. A person hired before January 1, 1996, must
obtain the certificate not later than December 31, 1998. The village may seek a
waiver from the board extending the period for compliance. A waiver shall be
issued only for good and justifiable reasons and may not extend the initial
period by more than ninety (90) days. If training is required and not completed
within the applicable time period, as extended by any waiver that may be
granted, then the officer must forfeit his or her position.
      3.   Training Course: The part time police training course referred to
herein shall be of similar content and of the same number of hours as courses
for full time officers and shall be provided by mobile team in-service training
units under the intergovernmental law enforcement officers in-service training
act in a manner prescribed by the board.
      4.   Additional Training Programs: The board may initiate, administer and
conduct training programs for part time police officers in addition to the
basic part time police training course. Training for part time police officers
may be given in any school selected by the board. The village corporate
authority may elect to participate in the advanced training for part time
police officers, but nonparticipation in this program shall not in any way
affect the mandatory responsibility of the village to participate in the basic
recruit training program for part time police officers. The failure of any part
time police officer to successfully complete any advanced training course shall
not affect the officer's status as a member of the police department. (Ord.
2013-09, 4-23-2013)
      5.   Discipline, Restrictions, Requirements: The village corporate
authority may appoint, discipline, and discharge a part time police officer.
Part time police officers shall be members of the regular police department
except for pension purposes. Part time police officers shall not be assigned
under any circumstances to supervise or direct full time police officers of the
police department. Part time police officers shall not be used as permanent
replacements for permanent full time police officers. The number of hours a
part time officer may work within a calendar year is restricted. Part time
police officers shall be trained under the intergovernmental law enforcement
officers in- service training act in accordance with the procedures for part
time police officers established by the board. A part time police officer hired
after January 1, 1996, who has not yet received certification under the
Illinois police training act shall be directly supervised. Part time officers
shall be under the disciplinary jurisdiction of the chief of police. Part time
police officers serve at the discretion of the corporate authorities, shall not
have any property rights in said employment, and may be removed by the village
administrator at any time after consultation with the chief of police. Part
time police officers shall comply with all applicable rules and general orders
issued by the police department. (Ord. 2015-29, 5-26-2015)
      6.   Hiring Standards: Any person employed as a part time police officer
must meet the following standards:
         a.   Be of good moral character, of temperate habits, of sound health,
and physically and mentally able to perform assigned duties.
         b.   Be at least twenty one (21) years of age.
         c.   Possess a valid state of Illinois driver's license.
         d.   Possess no prior felony convictions.
         e.   The applicant shall be fingerprinted and pass a background
investigation.
         f.   Must reside within thirty five (35) miles of the limits of the
village of Fox Lake.
         g.   Possess a high school diploma or GED certificate. (Ord. 2013-09,
4-23-2013)
 
Notes
1 1. 50 ILCS 705/1 et seq.
1-9-1-4: DUTIES 1 :
It shall be the duty of the members of the police department to enforce the
ordinances of the village and laws of the state effective in the village. They
shall preserve order, prevent infractions of the law and arrest violators of
the law or ordinances of the village. (1975 Code § 3.06)

8-7-1978)

1 2. 40 ILCS 5/3-101 et seq.
1-9-1-6: NONRESIDENT LOCK OUT FEE:
The fee to be charged for entry into a locked vehicle by the police department
shall be fifty dollars ($50.00); provided, however, that the fee shall not be
imposed:
   A.   On a village resident requesting entry to a locked vehicle that he or
she has a current right to operate;
   B.   On an operator of a vehicle owned by any federal, state, county, or
municipal agency if the operator is engaged in the course of his or her
federal, state, county, or municipal duties;
   C.   On an operator of a vehicle, when that vehicle or its contents poses a
hazard and therefore the vehicle must be removed immediately from its current
location;
   D.   On an operator, regardless of village residency, of a locked vehicle
that is occupied by a person that cannot unlock the vehicle and there is a
potential health or safety risk; or
   E.   For any other emergency circumstance as determined by the responding
police officer. (Ord. 2010-31, 10-26-2010)
1-9-1-7: FINGERPRINTING FEES:
A fee of fifteen dollars ($15.00) shall be charged by the police department to
nonresidents of the village for fingerprinting an individual at the request of
such a nonresident. No fee will be charged for residents, business enterprises
located within the corporate limits of the village, or school districts with
facilities within the village limits. (Ord. 2010-31, 10-26-2010)
1-9-2: FIRE DEPARTMENT:
1-9-2-1: CREATED:
There is hereby created a fire department of the village which shall consist of
a chief and such other members as the board of trustees may from time to time
prescribe. (Ord. 78-35, 11-6-1978)
1-9-2-2: CHIEF OF THE FIRE DEPARTMENT:
   A.   Appointment: The chief of the fire department shall be appointed by the
president by and with the advice and consent of the board of trustees, the
recommendation of the active membership, and the Fox Lake fire protection
trustees. The fire chief shall be in charge of the fire department and all
members thereof shall be subject to his orders. (Ord. 78-35, 11-6-1978; amd.
Ord. 97-18, 6-3-1997)
   B.   Duties: He may make rules for the functioning of the fire department,
subject to the approval of the president and board of trustees. He shall keep
such records and make such reports of the activities of the department as may
be required by statute or ordinance.
   C.   Compensation: The compensation of the fire chief and members of the
department shall be established by the village president and board of trustees.
(Ord. 78-35, 11-6-1978)
1-9-2-3: MEMBERS:
(Rep. by Ord. 89-4, 2-6-1989)
1-9-2-4: POWERS AND DUTIES:
   A.   Duties: It shall be the duty of the members of the fire department to
perform any duties delegated to them by the chief of the fire department and
the guidelines establishing the standard operating procedures governing the Fox
Lake fire department as outlined in ordinance 97-18. (Ord. 78-35, 11-6-1978;
amd. Ord. 97-18, 6-3-1997)
   B.   Volunteer Department's Powers: It shall be the duty of the members of
the volunteer fire department to perform any duties delegated to them by the
chief of the fire department. (Ord. 89-5, 2-6-1989)
1-9-2-5: COMMAND AT FIRES:
   A.   In case of fire, the chief and his assistants shall rank in order named
and the officer of the highest rank at the fire shall take command of the fire
department and direct the management thereof for the suppression of the fire in
the best manner possible. When it may be necessary for the protection of other
property and to prevent the spread of the conflagration, the officer in command
may cause buildings to be removed, torn down or destroyed in the best manner
possible. (1975 Code § 18.12)
   B.   It shall be unlawful for any fireman in attendance at a fire to refuse
to obey the order of the officer in command at such fire. (1975 Code § 18.15)
1-9-2-6: ORGANIZATIONS:
(Rep. by Ord. 89-6, 2-6-1989)
1-9-2-7: ENTERING FIREHOUSES:
It shall be unlawful for any person or persons to enter the fire department
house or any place where the equipment and apparatus of the department is
stored, at any time except on business pertaining to the fire department or
other village business. (1975 Code § 18.16)
1-9-2-8: CHARGES FOR AMBULANCE SERVICES:
Persons receiving ambulance services within the village shall be billed and
shall pay at the rates as established by the Fox Lake fire protection district
from time to time. (Ord. 2010-31, 10-26-2010)
