residence and length of residence at such address, also business address if
other than present address.
   B.   Address of place of residence during the past three (3) years if other
than present address.
   C.   Date of birth of applicant.
   D.   Physical description of applicant.
   E.   Name and address of the person, firm or corporation or association whom
the applicant is employed by or represents; and the length of time of such
employment or representation.
   F.   Name and address of employer during the past three (3) years if other
than the present employer.
   G.   Description sufficient for identification of the subject matter of the
soliciting in which the applicant will engage.
   H.   Period of time for which the certificate is applied.
   I.   The date, or approximate date, of the latest previous application for
certificate under this section
3-4-20, if any.
   J.   Whether a certificate of registration issued to the applicant under
this section
3-4-20 has ever been revoked.
   K.   Whether the applicant has ever been convicted of a violation of a
felony under the laws of the state of Illinois or any other state or federal
law of the United States.
All statements made by the applicant upon the application or in connection
therewith shall be under oath.
The chief of police shall cause to be kept in his office an accurate record of
every application received and acted upon together with all other information
received and acted upon together with all other information and dates
pertaining thereto and all certificates of registration issued under the
provisions of this section
3-4-20, and of the denial of applications. Applications for certificates shall
be numbered in consecutive order as filed, and every certificate issued, and
any renewal thereof, shall be identified with the duplicate number of the
application upon which it was issued. (Ord. 94-2, 2-22-1994)
3-4-20-8: CAUSES FOR DENIAL:
No certificate of registration shall be issued under this section
3-4-20 to any person who has been convicted of the commission of a felony under
the laws of the state of Illinois or any other state or federal law of the
United States, within five (5) years of the date of the application; nor to any
person who has been convicted of a violation of any of the provisions of this
section, nor to any person whose certificate of registration issued hereunder
has previously been revoked as herein provided. (Ord. 94-2, 2-22-1994)
3-4-20-9: IDENTIFICATION:
Every person who solicits under this section
3-4-20 shall identify himself as a recipient of a certificate of registration
pursuant to this section
3-4-20 upon demand by the occupant of the commercial establishment in which the
applicant is soliciting. Said certificate of registration shall be shown to the
occupant of the commercial establishment upon request. (Ord. 94-2, 2-22-1994)
3-4-20-10: VIOLATION:
No person soliciting pursuant to this section
3-4-20 on behalf of such an organization shall intentionally or unnecessarily
hinder, obstruct or delay, or wilfully or unnecessarily attempt to delay,
hinder or obstruct any other person from lawfully conducting his or her
business in and upon the commercial establishment in which the solicitation is
undertaken. (Ord. 94-2, 2-22-1994)
3-4-21: HIGHWAY SOLICITATION:
3-4-21-1: PERMIT REQUIRED:
No person shall stand on a highway within the village for the purpose of
soliciting contributions from the occupant of any vehicle without a permit from
the village. (Ord. 2016-15, 4-12-2016)
3-4-21-2: ELIGIBLE ORGANIZATIONS:
Permits may only be issued to:
   A.   A charitable organization 1  or institution organized that is operated
to benefit an indefinite number of the public subject to the following
provisions:
      1.   Persons engaged in the solicitation are limited to employees,
members or current volunteers of the charitable organization. Paid solicitors
are prohibited.
      2.   Soliciting shall be solely in an area that is within the service
area of the village.
   B.   Organizations that are registered with the attorney general as a
charitable organization as provided by 225 Illinois Compiled Statutes 460/1 et
seq., solicitation for charity act, and who are engaged in a statewide
fundraising activity. (Ord. 2016-15, 4-12-2016)
 
Notes
1 1. As defined in 230 ILCS 30/2.
3-4-21-3: PERMIT APPLICATION:
Applications for charitable solicitation shall be filed with the police
department not less than twenty (20) business days before the date that the
solicitation is to begin and shall include the following information:
   A.   The date or dates and times of day when the solicitation is to occur.
   B.   The location or locations where the solicitation is to occur.
   C.   The manner and conditions under which the solicitation is to occur.
(Ord. 2016-15, 4-12-2016)
3-4-21-4: PERMIT CONDITIONS:
A solicitation permit shall be subject to the following conditions:
   A.   A permit shall not be issued unless the solicitation will take place in
previously designated locations that have been determined by the village to be
safe for solicitations and safe for motorists; where there will not be
interference with the orderly flow of traffic; and where there will not be
interference with the operation of official traffic control devices and as
otherwise provided by state statute.
   B.   All permittees shall be liable for any injuries to any person or
property during the solicitation which is causally related to an act of
ordinance negligence of the soliciting agent. Proof of a valid liability
insurance policy in the amount of at least one million dollars ($1,000,000.00)
insuring the charity or local agency against bodily injury and property damage
arising out of or in connection with the solicitation shall be required.
   C.   Persons engaged in soliciting must be sixteen (16) years of age or
older and shall wear a high visibility vest at all times. (Ord. 2016-15, 4-12-
2016)
3-4-21-5: APPLICATION REVIEW:
The chief of police or designee shall review all soliciting applications and
shall, within five (5) business days from the date of application, accept or
reject the application. If an application is approved soliciting shall only be
permitted on the requested date(s) and may be subject to additional written
reasonable conditions that are based on articulated public safety concerns.
(Ord. 2016-15, 4-12-2016)
3-4-21-6: FILING AND NOTICE:
The police chief or his designee, shall forward the approved application to the
village clerk for filing at the village hall and shall make notice to the
village administrator, mayor and village board that such solicitation is taking
place within the village. (Ord. 2016-15, 4-12-2016)
3-4-22: PENALTY:
Unless otherwise provided, any person who violates any provision of this
chapter shall be subject to a fine of not less than fifty dollars ($50.00) nor
more than seven hundred fifty dollars ($750.00) for each offense. Each day that
the violation continues shall be considered a separate offense subject to the
penalties prescribed. (Ord. 2016-15, 4-12-2016)
CHAPTER 5
MASSAGE PARLORS
SECTION:
3-5-1: Definitions
3-5-2: Massage Establishment Permit
3-5-2-1: Required
3-5-2-2: Application; Fee
3-5-2-3: Issuance Or Denial; Additional Investigation
3-5-2-4: Display
3-5-2-5: Expiration
3-5-2-6: Transferability
3-5-2-7: Revocation Or Suspension
3-5-3: Masseur Or Masseuse Permit
3-5-3-1: Required
3-5-3-2: Application
3-5-3-3: Identification Card
3-5-4: Time Limit For Filing Application For Permit
3-5-5: Employment Of Masseurs And Masseuses
3-5-6: Rules And Regulations
3-5-7: Inspections
3-5-8: Treatment Of Opposite Sex
3-5-9: Advertising
3-5-10: Outcall Service
3-5-11: Exemptions
3-5-12: Violation, Penalty
3-5-1: DEFINITIONS:
For the purpose of this Chapter, the following words and phrases shall have the
meanings respectively ascribed to them by this Section:
   EMPLOYEE: Any and all persons other than the masseur or masseuse, who render
any service to the permittee, who receive compensation directly from the
permittee, and who have no physical contact with customers and clients.
   MASSAGE: Any method of pressure on or friction against or stroking,
kneading, rubbing, tapping, pounding, vibrating or stimulating of the external
soft parts of the body with the hands or with the aid of any mechanical or
electrical apparatus or appliance, with or without such supplementary aids as
rubbing alcohol, liniments, antiseptics, oils, powder, creams, lotions,
ointments or other similar preparations commonly used in the practice.
   MASSAGE ESTABLISHMENT: Any establishment having a fixed place of business
where any person, firm, association or corporation engages in, or carries on,
or permits to be engaged in or carried on any of the activities mentioned in
the definition of "massage".
   MASSEUR OR MASSEUSE: Any person who, for any consideration whatsoever,
engages in the practice of "massage" as herein defined.
   OUTCALL MASSAGE SERVICE: Any business, the function of which is to engage in
or carry on massages at a location designated by the customer or client rather
than at a massage establishment.
   PERMITTEE: The operator of a massage establishment.
   SEXUAL OR GENITAL AREA: Shall include the genitals, pubic area, buttocks,
anus or perineum of any person or the vulva or breasts of a female. (Ord. 81-
12, 4-20-1981)
3-5-2: MASSAGE ESTABLISHMENT PERMIT:
3-5-2-1: REQUIRED:
It shall be unlawful for any person to engage in, conduct or carry on, or to
permit to be engaged in, conducted or carried on, in or upon any premises in
the Village, the operation of a "massage establishment" as herein defined
without first having obtained a permit from the Village Treasurer. (Ord. 81-12,
4-20-1981; amd. Ord. 89-34, 2-6-1989)
3-5-2-2: APPLICATION; FEE:
   A.   Every applicant for a permit to maintain, operate or conduct a massage
establishment shall file an application in duplicate under oath with the
Village Treasurer upon a form provided by said Village Treasurer and pay a
nonrefundable filing fee of one hundred dollars ($100.00) to the Village
Treasurer. The Treasurer shall then issue a receipt which shall be attached to
the application filed with him. An annual license fee of fifty dollars ($50.00)
shall be paid on or before May 1 of each year. (Ord. 2000-31, 7-3-2000)
   B.   The Village Treasurer shall, within five (5) days, refer copies of such
application to the Building Department, the Zoning Department, Police
Department and the Fire Department. These departments shall, within thirty (30)
days, inspect the premises proposed to be operated as a massage establishment
and make written recommendations to the Village Treasurer concerning compliance
with the codes that they administer. (Ord. 81-12, 4-20-1981; amd. Ord. 89-34,
2-6-1989)
   C.   The applicant practitioner or therapist shall provide proof of
successful completion of a massage therapy program that is accredited by the
American Massage Therapy Association; or shall have passed the National
Certification examination for therapeutic massage and body work; or shall have
passed the International Myomassethics Federation, Inc., certification; or any
other certification approved by the license officer. The application for a
permit to operate a massage establishment shall set forth the exact nature of
the massage to be administered, and the proposed place of business and
facilities therefor. (Ord. 2000-11, 4-10-2000)
   D.   In addition to the foregoing, any applicant for a permit, including any
partner or limited partner of a partnership applicant, and any officer or
director of a corporate applicant and any stockholder holding more than five
percent (5%) of the stock of a corporate applicant, shall furnish the following
information:
      1.   Name and address.
      2.   Written proof that the individual is at least eighteen (18) years of
age.
      3.   All residential addresses for the past five (5) years.
      4.   The applicant's height, weight, color of eyes and hair.
      5.   The business, occupation or employment of the applicant for the five
(5) years immediately preceding the date of application.
      6.   The massage or similar business license history of the applicant;
whether such person, in previously operating in this or another city or state
under license, has had such license revoked or suspended, the reason therefor,
and the business activity or occupation subsequent to such action of suspension
or revocation.
      7.   All criminal or city ordinance violation convictions, forfeiture of
bond and pleadings of nolo contendere on all charges, except minor traffic
violations.
      8.   The fingerprints and photograph of the applicant.
      9.   If the applicant is a corporation, or a partner of a partnership is
a corporation, the name of the corporation shall be set forth exactly as shown
in its articles of incorporation. (Ord. 81-12, 4-20-1981)
3-5-2-3: ISSUANCE OR DENIAL; ADDITIONAL INVESTIGATION:
   A.   Upon receipt of the recommendations of the departments referred to in
subsection
3-5-2-2B of this Chapter and written certification by the Zoning Department
that a special use permit has been issued to the applicant, the Village
Treasurer shall issue a permit to maintain, operate or conduct a massage
establishment, unless he finds that: (Ord. 81-12, 4-20-1981; amd. Ord. 89-34,
2-6-1989)
      1.   The operation, as proposed by the applicant, if permitted, does not
comply with all laws, including, but not limited to, the building, zoning and
fire codes 1  of the Village.
      2.   The applicant and any other person who will be directly or
indirectly engaged in the management and operation of a massage establishment
has been convicted of:
         a.   A felony;
         b.   An offense involving sexual misconduct with children; or
         c.   Prostitution, pimping or other offense opposed to decency and
morality.
      3.   The applicant has had a massage business, masseur or other similar
permit or license denied, revoked or suspended by the Village within five (5)
years prior to the date of the application. (Ord. 81-12, 4-20-1981)
   B.   The Chief of Police, at his discretion, may advise issuance of a permit
by the Village Treasurer to any person convicted of any of the crimes in
subsections A2a through A2c of this Section if he finds that such conviction
occurred at least five (5) years prior to the date of application, the
applicant has had no subsequent convictions and the applicant has shown
evidence of rehabilitation sufficient to warrant the public trust.
   C.   Within ten (10) days of receipt of the recommendations of the aforesaid
departments, the Village Treasurer shall notify the applicant that his
application is granted, denied or held for further investigation. The period of
such additional investigation shall not exceed an additional thirty (30) days
unless otherwise agreed to by the applicant. Upon the conclusion of such
additional investigation, the Village Treasurer shall advise the applicant in
writing whether the application is granted or denied.
   D.   Whenever an application is denied or held for further investigation,
the Village Treasurer shall advise the applicant in writing of the reasons for
such action.
   E.   The failure or refusal of the applicant to promptly give any
information relevant to the investigation of the application or his or her
refusal or failure to appear at any reasonable time and place for examination
under oath regarding the said application or his or her refusal to submit to or
cooperate with any inspection required by this Chapter shall constitute an
admission by the applicant that he or she is ineligible for such permit and
shall be grounds for denial thereof by the Village Treasurer. (Ord. 81-12, 4-
20-1981; amd. Ord. 89-34, 2-6-1989)
 
Notes
1 1. See Title 6, Chapter 1; Section 9-1-1; and Title 4, Chapter 4, Article A,
  of this Code.
3-5-2-4: DISPLAY:
Every permittee shall display a valid permit in a conspicuous place within the
massage establishment so that the same may be readily seen by persons entering
the premises. Each practitioner while on the premises, whether working or not,
shall wear an ID tag displaying a photograph of the practitioner together with
the practitioner's name. (Ord. 2000-11, 4-10-2000)
3-5-2-5: EXPIRATION:
Every massage establishment permit issued pursuant to this Chapter will
terminate at the expiration of one year from the date of its issuance, unless
sooner suspended, revoked or renewed pursuant to provisions of this Chapter.
(Ord. 81-12, 4-20-1981)
3-5-2-6: TRANSFERABILITY:
No permit for the operation of a massage establishment issued pursuant to the
provisions of this Chapter shall be transferable; provided, however, that upon
the death or incapacity of the permittee, the massage establishment may
continue in business for a reasonable period of time to allow for an orderly
transfer of the permit in such manner as to comply with these provisions. (Ord.
81-12, 4-20-1981)
3-5-2-7: REVOCATION OR SUSPENSION:
   A.   Any permit issued for a massage establishment may be revoked or
suspended by the President after a hearing for good cause or in any case where
any of the provisions of this Chapter are violated or:
      1.   Any employee of the permittee, including a masseur or masseuse, is
engaged in any conduct at permittee's place of business which violates any of
the provisions of this Chapter or any State law which provides for
imprisonment, and permittee has actual or constructive knowledge of such
violations or the permittee should have actual or constructive knowledge by due
diligence.
      2.   Any applicant has made a false statement on an application for a
permit under this Chapter or in any case where the permittee or licensee
refuses to permit any duly authorized police officer, building or fire
inspector of the Village to inspect the premises or the operations therein.
   B.   Such permit may also be revoked or suspended by the President after
hearing upon the recommendations of the Police, Building or Fire Department
officer that such business is being managed, conducted or maintained without
regard for the safety of patrons and customers.
   C.   Any violation of this Chapter by an employee of the permittee,
including a masseur or masseuse, shall be cause for suspension of the permit
for not more than thirty (30) days in the first instance. Any subsequent
violation of this Chapter by an employee of the permittee, including a masseur
or masseuse, shall be cause for suspension or revocation of the permit.
   D.   The President, before revoking or suspending any permit, shall give the
permittee at least ten (10) days' written notice of the charges against him or
her and the opportunity for a public hearing before the President, at which
time the permittee may present evidence bearing upon the question. In such
cases, the charges shall be specific and in writing. (Ord. 81-12, 4-20-1981)
3-5-3: MASSEUR OR MASSEUSE PERMIT:
3-5-3-1: REQUIRED:
Any person, including an applicant for massage establishment permit, who
engages in the practice of "massage" as herein defined, shall file an
application for a masseur or masseuse permit with the Village Treasurer upon a
form provided by said Village Treasurer and shall pay a nonrefundable filing
fee of one hundred dollars ($100.00) for an original application and fifty
dollars ($50.00) for a renewal application. A nonrefundable fee of twenty five
dollars ($25.00) shall be charged for each background check of each therapist
and each employee. The Village Treasurer shall issue a receipt which shall be
attached to the application filed with him. (Ord. 2000-31, 7-3-2000)
3-5-3-2: APPLICATION:
The application for a masseur or masseuse permit shall contain the following:
   A.   Name and residence address.
   B.   Social security number and driver's license number, if any.
   C.   Applicant's weight, height, color of hair and eyes.
   D.   Written evidence that the applicant is at least eighteen (18) years of
age.
   E.   Business, occupation or employment of the applicant for the five (5)
years immediately preceding the date of application.
   F.   Whether the applicant has ever been convicted of, pleaded nolo
contendere to or suffered a forfeiture on a bond on a charge of committing any
crime except minor traffic violations. If the answer is in the affirmative, a
statement must be made giving the place and the court in which such conviction
plea or forfeiture was had, the specific charge under which the conviction plea
or forfeiture was obtained and the sentence imposed as a result thereof.
   G.   The Chief of Police, or his delegate, shall have the right to take
fingerprints and a photograph of the applicant and the right to confirm the
information submitted. (Ord. 81-12, 4-20-1981)
   H.   All persons who desire to perform the services of masseur or masseuse
at a massage establishment, shall first undergo a physical examination for
contagious and communicable diseases, which shall include a recognized blood
test for syphilis; a culture for gonorrhea; a test or tests which will
demonstrate freedom from tuberculosis, which is to be made and interpreted by a
licensed physician; and, such other laboratory tests as may be necessitated by
the above examination. The applicant shall furnish to the Village Treasurer a
certificate based upon the applicant's physical examination and issued within
thirty (30) days of such examination, signed by a physician duly licensed by
the State and stating that the person examined is either free from any
contagious or communicable disease or incapable of communicating any of such
diseases to others. Such persons shall undergo physical examination referred to
above and submit to the Village Treasurer the certificate required herein prior
to commencement of their employment and at least once every twelve (12) months
thereafter. (Ord. 81-12, 4-20-1981; amd. Ord. 89-34, 2-6-1989)
3-5-3-3: IDENTIFICATION CARD:
The Village Treasurer shall provide each masseur and masseuse granted a permit
with an identification card which shall contain a photograph of the masseur or
masseuse and the full name and permit number assigned to the said masseur or
masseuse. This card must be worn on the front of the outermost garment at all
times during the hours of operation of any establishment granted a permit
pursuant to this Chapter. (Ord. 81-12, 4-20-1981; amd. Ord. 89-34, 2-6-1989)
3-5-4: TIME LIMIT FOR FILING APPLICATION FOR PERMIT:
All persons who presently operate a massage establishment or who are employed
as a masseur or masseuse must file for a permit within sixty (60) days of the
effective date of this Chapter. Applications for renewal of permits must be
filed not more than sixty (60) days nor less than thirty (30) days prior to
termination of an existing permit. (Ord. 81-12, 4-20-1981)
3-5-5: EMPLOYMENT OF MASSEURS AND MASSEUSES:
It shall be the responsibility of the permittee for the massage establishment
or the employer of any persons purporting to act as masseurs and masseuses to
ensure that each person employed as a masseur or masseuse shall first have
obtained a valid permit pursuant to this Chapter. (Ord. 81-12, 4-20-1981)
3-5-6: RULES AND REGULATIONS:
   A.   President's Powers: The President may, after public hearing, make and
enforce reasonable rules and regulations not in conflict with, but to carry out
the intent of this Chapter.
   B.   Maintaining Public Nuisance: Any building used as a massage
establishment in violation of this Chapter with the intentional, knowing,
reckless or negligent permission of the owner thereof, or the agent of the
owner managing the building, together with all fixtures and other property used
in violation of this Chapter are hereby declared to be a nuisance.
   C.   Business Practices:
      1.   All massage establishments shall be provided with clean, laundered
sheets and towels in sufficient quantity. They shall be laundered after each
use thereof and stored in a sanitary manner.
      2.   The sexual or genital area of patrons must be covered by towels,
cloths or undergarments when in the presence of an employee, masseur or
masseuse.
      3.   It shall be unlawful for any person in a massage establishment, to
knowingly place his or her hand upon, to touch with any part of his or her
body, to fondle in any manner, or to massage, a sexual genital area of any
other person.
      4.   No masseur or masseuse, employee or operator shall perform, offer or
agree to perform, any act which would require the touching of the patron's
genital area.
      5.   All walls, ceilings, floors, pools, showers, bathtubs, steam rooms,
and all other physical facilities shall be in good repair and maintained in a
clean and sanitary condition. Wet and dry heat rooms, steam or vapor rooms, or
steam or vapor cabinets, shower compartments and toilet rooms shall be
thoroughly cleaned each day the business is in operation. Bathtubs and showers
shall be thoroughly cleaned after each use. When carpeting is used on the
floors, it shall be kept dry.
      6.   Oils, creams, lotions or other preparations used in administering
massages shall be kept in clean, closed containers or cabinets.
      7.   Eating in the massage work areas shall not be permitted. Animals,
except for seeing eye dogs, shall not be permitted in the massage work areas.
      8.   No masseur or masseuse shall administer a massage to a patron
exhibiting any skin fungus, skin infection, skin inflammation or skin eruption;
unless a physician duly licensed by the State certifies in writing that such
person be safely massaged and prescribing the conditions thereof.
      9.   Each masseur and masseuse shall wash his or her hands in hot running
water, using a proper soap or disinfectant before administering a massage to
each patron.
      10.   It shall be unlawful for any owner, proprietor, manager or other
person in charge of any massage establishment to employ any person who is not
at least eighteen (18) years of age. (Ord. 81-12, 4-20-1981)
3-5-7: INSPECTIONS:
The Police Department shall from time to time, and at least twice a year, make
an inspection of each massage establishment granted a permit under the
provisions of this Chapter for the purposes of determining that the provisions
of this Chapter are complied with. Such inspections shall be made at reasonable
times and in a reasonable manner. It shall be unlawful for any permittee to
fail to allow such inspection officer access to the premises or to hinder such
officer in any manner. (Ord. 81-12, 4-20-1981)
3-5-8: TREATMENT OF OPPOSITE SEX:
Treatment of persons of the opposite sex is restricted and shall be unlawful
for any person holding a permit, except upon the signed order of a licensed
physician, osteopath, chiropractor or registered physical therapist; which
shall be dated and shall specifically state the number of treatments given and
the name of the operator shall be entered on such order by the establishment
where such treatments are given and shall be subject to inspection by the
police pursuant to Section
 3-5-7 of this Chapter. The requirements of this Section shall not apply to
treatments given in the residence of a patient, the office of a licensed
physician, osteopath or registered physical therapist, chiropractor, or in a
regularly established and licensed hospital or sanitarium. (Ord. 81-12, 4-20-
1981)
3-5-9: ADVERTISING:
No massage establishment granted a permit under provisions of this Chapter
shall place, publish or distribute or cause to be placed, published or
distributed any advertising matter that depicts any portion of the human body
that would reasonably suggest to prospective patrons that any services are
available that are prohibited in this Chapter or that employees, masseurs or
masseuses are dressed in any manner other than prescribed in this Chapter.
(Ord. 81-12, 4-20-1981)
3-5-10: OUTCALL SERVICE:
No "outcall massage service" may be operated other than by a licensed massage
establishment. All massages performed by an "outcall massage service" must be
performed in the manner prescribed herein. (Ord. 81-12, 4-20-1981)
3-5-11: EXEMPTIONS:
These provisions shall not apply to hospitals, nursing homes, sanitaria or
persons holding an unrevoked certificate to practice the healing arts under the
laws of the State, or persons working under the direction of any such persons
or in any such establishments, nor shall this Chapter apply to barbers or
cosmetologists lawfully carrying out their particular profession or business
and holding a valid, unrevoked license or certificate of registration issued by
the State. (Ord. 81-12, 4-20-1981)
3-5-12: VIOLATION, PENALTY:
Every person, except those persons who are specifically exempted by this
Chapter, whether acting as an individual, owner, employee of the owner,
operator or employee of the operator, or whether acting as a mere helper for
the owner, employee or operator, or acting as a participant or worker in any
way, who gives massages or conducts a massage establishment without first
obtaining a permit and paying a license fee to do so from the Village, or shall
violate any of the provisions of this Chapter, shall be guilty of a
misdemeanor. Upon conviction, such person shall be punished by a fine not to
exceed five hundred dollars ($500.00), or by imprisonment for a period not to
exceed six (6) months or by both such fine and imprisonment. Each day during
which a violation exists shall constitute a separate and individual
misdemeanor. (Ord. 81-12, 4-20-1981)
CHAPTER 6
ADULT ENTERTAINMENT ESTABLISHMENTS
SECTION:
3-6-1: Definitions
3-6-2: Liquor Prohibited
3-6-3: Location
3-6-4: Special Use Permit Required
3-6-5: Registration
3-6-6: Exterior Display
3-6-7: Minimum Age
3-6-8: Existing Adult Uses
3-6-9: License Required
3-6-10: Application; Fee
3-6-11: Application Contents
3-6-12: Restrictions
3-6-13: Prohibited Acts; Penalties
3-6-14: Severability
3-6-15: Repeal And Saving Clause
3-6-16: Effective Date
3-6-1: DEFINITIONS:
For purposes of this Chapter, the following definitions apply:
   ADULT BOOK STORE: An establishment having a substantial or significant
portion of its sales or stock-in-trade, books, magazines, films for sale or
rental or for viewing on-premises by use of motion picture devices or by coin-
operated means, and periodicals which are distinguished or characterized by
their emphasis on matter depicting, describing or relating to "specified sexual
activities", or "specified anatomical areas"; or an establishment with a
segment or section devoted to the sale or display of such materials; or an
establishment that holds itself out to the public as a purveyor of such
materials based upon its signage, advertising, displays, actual sales, presence
of video preview or coin-operated booths, exclusion of minors from the
establishment's premises or any other factor showing the establishment's
primary purpose is to purvey such material.
   ADULT ENTERTAINMENT CABARET: A public or private establishment which: a)
features topless dancers, strippers, male or female impersonators, whether
employed by a facility or not; b) not infrequently features entertainers who
display "specified anatomical areas"; or c) features entertainers or allows
persons, who by reason of their appearance or conduct, to perform in a manner
which is designed primarily to appeal to the prurient interest of the patron or
entertainers who engage in or are engaged in explicit simulation of "specified
sexual activities".
   ADULT GIFT SHOP: An establishment having a substantial or significant
portion of its stock-in-trade pictures, photographs, drawings, diagrams,
paraphernalia, apparatus or other objects which are distinguished or
characterized by their emphasis on matter depicting, describing or relating to
"specified sexual activities" or "specified anatomical areas" or an
establishment with a segment or section devoted to the sale or display of such
material.
   ADULT MOTION PICTURE THEATER: A building or area used for presenting
materials distinguished or characterized by an emphasis on matter depicting,
describing or relating to "specified sexual activities" or "specified
anatomical areas" for observation by patrons therein.
   ADULT USE: Adult bookstores, adult entertainment cabarets, adult gift shops,
adult motion picture theaters and other similar uses.
   SPECIFIED ANATOMICAL AREAS: A. Less than completely and opaquely covered: 1)
human genitals, pubic region, 2) buttock, 3) female breasts below a point
immediately above the top of the areola; and
   B.   Human male genitals in a discernibly turgid state, even if completely
and opaquely covered.
   SPECIFIED SEXUAL ACTIVITIES: A. Human genitals in the state of sexual
stimulation or arousal;
   B.   Acts of human masturbation, sexual intercourse or sodomy; and
   C.   Fondling or erotic touching of human genitals, pubic region, buttock or
female breasts. (Ord. 98-21, 2-17-1998)
3-6-2: LIQUOR PROHIBITED:
No liquor license shall be issued and no liquor shall be sold or consumed on
the premises of any adult use. (Ord. 98-21, 2-17-1998)
3-6-3: LOCATION:
Adult uses may be allowed, upon obtaining a special use permit, in the M-
2 District, provided:
   A.   No adult use shall be located within one thousand feet (1,000') of the
lot line of any property which is zoned or used for residences, churches,
schools, public libraries, parks, youth recreation facilities, daycare centers
or other adult use.
   B.   No adult use facility may have any private or semiprivate rooms which
are shielded from view from the general public areas, and which are not
accessible by the general public. (Ord. 98-21, 2-17-1998)
3-6-4: SPECIAL USE PERMIT REQUIRED:
No adult use shall operate even at those locations where they may be allowed
pursuant to Section
3-6-3 of this Chapter without first having obtained a special use permit in the
manner set forth in section 9-1-6-10 of the Village Zoning Ordinance. However,
the standards for special uses set forth in section 9-1-6-10 of the Village
Zoning Ordinance shall not apply with regard to the application for a special
use permit for an adult use. In their place the following standards shall
apply:
   A.   Standards: No adult special use permit shall be granted by the Village
Board unless the Board finds:
      1.   The design and operation of the facility shall not adversely affect
the public health and safety;
      2.   It will not cause substantial injury to the value of other property
in the neighborhood in which it is located;
      3.   It will not unduly increase traffic congestion on the public streets
and highways in the area in which it is located;
      4.   It will not cause additional public expense for fire or police
protection;
      5.   It will not substantially increase the possibility of criminal acts
against persons and properties within five hundred feet (500') of such proposed
special use or against persons who regularly use such properties. (Ord. 98-21,
2-17-1998)
3-6-5: REGISTRATION:
The owner of a building or premises, his agent for the purposes of managing,
controlling or collecting rents, or any other person managing or controlling a
building or premises on any property which contains an adult use, shall
register the following information with the Village Clerk (the same information
must be provided with the application for the special use):
   A.   The address of the premises;
   B.   The name of the owner of the premises and names of the beneficial
owners if the property is in a land trust;
   C.   The address of the owner and the beneficial owners;
   D.   The name of the business or establishment subject to the provisions of
this Chapter;
   E.   The names, addresses and dates of birth of the owner, beneficial owners
or the major stockholders (over 5 percent interest) of the business or
establishment subject to the provisions of this Chapter;
   F.   The date of initiation of the adult use;
   G.   The nature of the adult use;
   H.   If the premises or building is leased, a copy of said lease must be
attached, along with written approval by lessor;
   I.   Listing of any arrests or convictions of persons noted in subsection E
of this Section excepting minor traffic violations; and
   J.   Name and location of any other adult use location. (Ord. 98-21, 2-17-
1998)
3-6-6: EXTERIOR DISPLAY:
No adult use shall be conducted in any manner that permits the observation of
any material depicting, describing or relating to "specified sexual activities"
or "specified anatomical areas" from any public way or from any property not
registered as an adult use. This provision shall apply to any display,
decoration, sign, show window or other opening. (Ord. 98-21, 2-17-1998)
3-6-7: MINIMUM AGE:
No person under twenty one (21) years of age shall be permitted on the
premises, including patrons and employees. (Ord. 98-21, 2-17-1998)
3-6-8: EXISTING ADULT USES:
Any adult use which existed lawfully, but which becomes nonconforming upon the
adoption of this Chapter, may be continued as hereinafter provided:
   A.   Upon written notice from the Village to the owners or interest therein
that any building, structure, lot or regulated uses nonconforming, the owners
or interest therein shall, within two (2) months from the date of such notice,
apply to the Village Clerk for a certificate of nonconformance.
   B.   That failure to apply for a certificate of nonconformance within two
(2) months of the notice as provided in subsection A of this Section will
require the amortization of the nonconformance within six (6) months of the
notice provided for in subsection A of this Section.
   C.   Nonconformances that have applied for a certificate of nonconformance
from the Village Clerk shall be discontinued within one year of the notice
provided in subsection A of this Section. (Ord. 98-21, 2-17-1998)
3-6-9: LICENSE REQUIRED:
It shall be unlawful for any person to open, maintain, operate conduct or
permit to be operated on, in, or upon any premises in the Village, an adult
bookstore, adult entertainment cabaret, adult motion picture theater, adult
shop or other adult use, without having first obtained a license from the
Village Treasurer. (Ord. 98-21, 2-17-1998)
3-6-10: APPLICATION; FEE:
Every applicant for a license to open, maintain, operate or conduct an adult
bookstore, adult entertainment cabaret, adult motion picture theater, adult
shop or other adult use, shall file an application in duplicate with the
Village Treasurer and pay a nonrefundable filing fee of one thousand dollars
($1,000.00). Annual license renewal fee shall be five hundred dollars ($500.00)
payable on May 1 of each year. The Village Treasurer shall refer copies of such
application to the Building Department, Zoning Department, Police Department
and Fire Department, all of whom shall inspect the premises and make written
recommendations to the Village Treasurer within thirty (30) days of the
application date. The Village Treasurer shall either deny or approve said
application within forty five (45) days of the application date. (Ord. 98-21,
2-17-1998)
3-6-11: APPLICATION CONTENTS:
The application for such a license shall contain the exact name and address of
the applicant and the following information about the applicant and any partner
or limited partner of a partnership applicant, and any officer or director of a
corporate applicant and any stockholder owning more than five percent (5%) of a
corporate applicant, and any employee of the applicant who will work on the
premises:
   A.   Name and address;
   B.   Written proof that the individual is at least twenty one (21) years of
age;
   C.   All residential addresses for the past five (5) years;
   D.   Applicant's height, weight, and color of eyes and hair;
   E.   The business, occupation or employment of the applicant for the five
(5) years immediately preceding the date of application;
   F.   A statement of all similar businesses ever owned or participated in by
applicant, including a statement as to whether the applicant has ever held a
similar license from any other county or municipality and details of any
revocation of any such license;
   G.   All criminal or city ordinance violation convictions, forfeiture of
bond and pleadings of nolo contendere on all charges, except minor traffic
violations;
   H.   The fingerprints and photograph of the applicant;
   I.   A verification of the truth and accuracy of the application by an
applicant or officer of corporate applicant. (Ord. 98-21, 2-17-1998)
3-6-12: RESTRICTIONS:
The following restrictions shall apply to an application for adult book store,
adult cabaret, adult gift shop, adult motion picture theater or other adult
uses. No application shall be approved for a premises which:
   A.   Is located within one thousand feet (1,000') of the lot line of any
property which is zoned or used for residences, churches, schools, public
libraries, parks, youth recreation facilities, daycare centers or another adult
use.
   B.   Is located within one thousand feet (1,000') of another establishment
already operating a business defined hereunder or already licensed hereunder.
   C.   Has more than one outdoor sign advertising its existence or location.
   D.   Has an outdoor sign exceeding ten feet (10') in length or three feet
(3') in width.
   E.   Has an outdoor sign which contains any emphasis, either by wording or
picture or otherwise, of matters relating to sexual activities.
   F.   Displays the stock-in-trade of adult entertainment establishments to
the public view from outside the establishment.
   G.   Fails to post a notice at its door that entry by persons under twenty
one (21) is forbidden.
   H.   When the applicant, or any other person listed in Section
3-6-11 of this Chapter, has been convicted of a felony or crime of moral
turpitude, unless the applicant has affirmatively and clearly shown that the
applicant has been fully rehabilitated.
   I.   When the applicant, or any other person listed in Section
3-6-11 of this Chapter, has violated any ordinances of the Village, or had any
similar license revoked by the Village, or any other county or municipality
within the previous five (5) years. (Ord. 98-21, 2-17-1998)
3-6-13: PROHIBITED ACTS; PENALTIES:
   A.   It shall be deemed a violation of this Chapter by the applicant for the
applicant or any of its agents to do any of the following:
      1.   Place more than one outdoor sign on the premises advertising the
existence or location of applicant's business.
      2.   Place any sign on applicant's premises which has a length exceeding
ten feet (10') or width exceeding three feet (3').
      3.   Place any sign on applicant's premises which contains any emphasis,
either by wording or picture or otherwise of matters relating to specified
sexual activities or specified anatomical areas.
      4.   Display any of the applicant's stock-in-trade relating to specified
sexual activities or specified anatomical areas to the public view from outside
the establishment.
      5.   Fail to post a notice at its door that entry by any person under age
twenty one (21) is forbidden.
      6.   Allow any person under the age of twenty one (21) to enter the
premises or that portion of the premises where materials related to specified
sexual activities or specified anatomical areas are kept.
      7.   Give any false, inaccurate, incomplete or misleading information on
an application for a license.
   B.   Any person found guilty of violating any of the provisions of this
Section shall be fined not less than twenty five dollars ($25.00) nor more than
seven hundred fifty dollars ($750.00), and each day of each violation shall
constitute a separate offense.
   C.   Any person found guilty of violating subsection
3-6-11I of this Chapter shall be fined not less than two hundred dollars
($200.00) nor more than seven hundred fifty dollars ($750.00), and each day of
each violation shall constitute a separate offense.
   D.   If the applicant or any other person listed in Section
3-6-11 of this Chapter is convicted of a felony or crime of moral turpitude or
violation of any ordinance of the Village, the Chief of Police or Village
President shall have the power to revoke the license issued hereunder
forthwith. (Ord. 98-21, 2-17-1998)
3-6-14: SEVERABILITY:
In the event that any section, clause, provision or part of this Chapter shall
be found and determined to be invalid by a court of competent jurisdiction, all
valid parts that are severable from the invalid parts shall remain in full
force and effect. If any part of this Chapter is found to be invalid in any one
or more of its several applications, all valid applications that are severable
from the invalid applications shall remain in effect. (Ord. 98-21, 2-17-1998)
3-6-15: REPEAL AND SAVING CLAUSE:
All ordinances and parts of ordinances in conflict herewith are hereby
repealed; provided, however, that nothing herein contained shall affect any
rights, actions or causes of action which shall have accrued to the Village
prior to the effective date hereof. (Ord. 98-21, 2-17-1998)
3-6-16: EFFECTIVE DATE:
This Chapter shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage,
approval and publication as provided by law. (Ord. 98-21, 2-17-1998)
CHAPTER 7
TAXICABS
SECTION:
3-7-1: Definitions
3-7-2: License Required; Application
3-7-3: Licensing And Enforcement; Establishment Of Fees
3-7-4: Taxicab Drivers
3-7-5: Vehicles
3-7-6: Security For Property Damage
3-7-7: Unlawful Use
3-7-8: Passengers
3-7-9: Violations
3-7-10: Parking And Cabstands
3-7-11: Suspension Or Revocation Of Licenses
3-7-12: Penalty
3-7-1: DEFINITIONS:
   LICENSE YEAR: May 1 through April 30 of each year.
   OWNER: Any person having the use or control of one or more taxicabs herein
defined.
   PUBLIC PASSENGER VEHICLE: Taxicabs, livery vehicles, and public
transportation vehicle used for transportation of passengers for hire.
   PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION VEHICLE: Any privately owned first or second division
motor vehicle which is intended to be used for and is maintained or operated
for the nonemergency transportation of persons for compensation and any vehicle
registered as a public transportation vehicle by the secretary of state.
Excludes vehicles regulated by the Illinois commerce commission.
   TAXICAB: Any motor vehicle used or kept for use for the transportation of
passengers and their baggage for hire, indiscriminately accepting and
discharging all persons that may offer themselves for transportation. Taxicab
does not include motor vehicles rented by special contract to be operated by
the customer or any vehicle operating under the authority of special ordinance
or franchise or licensed motor vehicles for the transportation of passengers or
freight over a specific route.
   TAXICAB DRIVER'S CERTIFICATE: A license issued to a driver to enable the
driver to operate a taxicab within the village.
   TAXICAB OPERATOR'S LICENSE: A license issued to the owner of a taxicab
service that is eligible to operate taxicabs in the village.
   TAXICAB VEHICLE LICENSE: A license issued for public passenger vehicle,
which allows the vehicle to be operated as a taxicab within the village.
   TAXIMETER: Any mechanical or electrical device attached to a taxicab, which
records and indicates a charge or fare in dollars and cents measured by
distance traveled or waiting time or both.
   VILLAGE: The village of Fox Lake. (Ord. 2002-23, 5-14-2002)
3-7-2: LICENSE REQUIRED; APPLICATION:
It shall be unlawful to engage in the business of operating a taxicab service
in the village without first having secured a license therefor, pursuant to
subsection
3-1-6B of this title. Application for such license shall be made in writing to
the village clerk and shall state therein the following:
   A.   The full name and address of the owner.
   B.   The make and type of vehicle to be used.
   C.   The factory number thereof.
   D.   The state license number thereof.
   E.   The seating capacity thereof, according to its trade rating.
   F.   The length of time that the vehicle has been in use.
   G.   The horsepower thereof.
   H.   The village vehicle license number thereof.
A taxicab business license shall not be issued to anyone who has been convicted
of a felony. (Ord. 2002-23, 5-14-2002)
3-7-3: LICENSING AND ENFORCEMENT; ESTABLISHMENT OF FEES:
Every public passenger vehicle business is required to furnish clean,
comfortable, and safe service. Taxicab fares shall comply with the provisions
of this section. Limousines and public transportation vehicles shall provide
service at reasonable rates. All public passenger vehicles shall be operated in
accordance with this chapter and all other applicable statutes, ordinances,
codes, rules and regulations. (Ord. 2002-23, 5-14-2002)
   A.   The annual fee for such license is payable on or before May 1 and shall
be sixty dollars ($60.00) for each cab company or owner, which fee shall
include the privilege of operating one taxicab. An additional ten dollars
($10.00) shall be paid by every licensee for every additional taxicab operated
by him. All such fees shall be paid to the village treasurer at the time
application is made. In the event the license applied for has been denied, the
fee shall be returned to the applicant. License fee shall be in addition to all
other state and village vehicle fees or taxes provided for by state law or
village ordinances. (Ord. 2010-09, 4-13-2010)
   B.   Whenever the number of cabs so operated shall be increased during the
license year, the licensee shall notify the treasurer of such change and shall
pay the additional fee to the village treasurer. If a taxicab is withdrawn from
service and another taxicab replaces the one withdrawn, the licensee shall
notify the village treasurer who shall issue a tag or sticker for such
replacement taxicab, without additional charge to the licensee.
   C.   The licensee shall notify the village treasurer of the motor number and
of the license number of each cab operated and of the corresponding village tax
or sticker number.
   D.   The licensee shall submit a list of drivers to the village treasurer
semiannually.
   E.   No license to operate a taxicab shall be sold, transferred or assigned.
   F.   The licensing of operators of a taxicab business shall be under the
control and supervision of the village board or their designee. The enforcement
provisions of this chapter shall be under the control and supervision of the
chief of police, including the making of any vehicle and taximeter inspection
provided for by this chapter.
   G.   The chief of police shall have the authority to appoint such person, as
he may deem necessary to enforce the provisions of this chapter and to perform
any duties assigned to the chief of police by this chapter.
   H.   The village board or their designee shall have the authority to
establish fees for any license to be issued pursuant to this chapter. The
amount of any fee established by the village board shall be equivalent to or
based upon the costs incurred by the village in enforcing the provisions of
this chapter, including, but not limited to, the cost of issuing licenses. The
schedule of fees is set out in subsection A of this section. (Ord. 2002-23, 5-
14-2002)
3-7-4: TAXICAB DRIVERS:
   A.   License Required: No person shall drive a taxicab unless he shall have
secured a driver's license therefor as provided by state statute. No person
shall drive a taxicab until he has exhibited such driver's license to the chief
of police or his delegate who will issue a certificate that the applicant has
complied with the provisions of this chapter.
   B.   Qualified Drivers: The chief of police or his delegate shall examine
each applicant for a taxicab driver's certificate to determine the competency
of the applicant, and no such certificate shall be issued except if the chief
of police or his delegate certifies that the applicant is competent to operate
a taxicab as required herein. A person who has been convicted of a felony shall
not be allowed to drive a taxicab in the village.
   C.   Prohibited Acts: It shall be unlawful for any driver of a taxicab while
on duty to drink any intoxicating liquor, or to use any profane or obscene
language, to shout or call to prospective passengers, or to disturb the peace
in any way.
   D.   Cruising And Soliciting: No driver of a taxicab, while waiting for
employment, shall park or stand on any street or public place not designated or
established by the village board of trustees by ordinance. No driver of a
taxicab shall seek employment by repeatedly and persistently driving his
vehicle up and down the street adjoining any theater, hall, hotel, public
building or other place of public gathering or otherwise interfering with the
proper access to or egress from the places; but any driver may solicit
employment by driving through any street or public place without stops other
than those due to obstruction of traffic, and at the speed as not to interfere
with or impede traffic and may pass and repass before any of the above places
if after passing the public places he shall not repass until he has gone a
distance of three (3) blocks or more upon the streets and public ways of the
village. No persons shall solicit passengers for a taxicab except the driver
thereof when sitting upon the driver's seat of his vehicle. No person shall be
allowed to ride in the compartment with the driver while soliciting.
   E.   Carrying Dangerous Weapons: No driver of a taxicab shall have in his
possession or in or about the driver's compartment of the vehicle a firearm,
blackjack, or any other dangerous weapon. (Ord. 2002-23, 5-14-2002)
3-7-5: VEHICLES:
   A.   State License Required: No taxicab shall be operated unless it bears a
state taxicab license plate duly issued and a village of Fox Lake taxicab
vehicle license.
   B.   Equipment: No such cab shall be operated unless it is equipped with
proper brakes, lights, tires, horn, muffler, rear vision mirror and windshield
wiper in good condition.
   C.   Testing: Inspection is to be conducted by a certified automobile
service excellent technician at operator's cost and at the direction of the
chief of police. The taxicab shall be maintained in good appearance and well
painted.
   D.   Inspection: It shall be the duty of the chief of police or his delegate
to inspect every taxicab as often as may be necessary to see to the enforcement
of the provisions of this section. If a taxicab is directed to be removed from
service, the owner or operator is wholly responsible for any towing and impound
charges that occur.
   E.   Identification: Each taxicab shall have on each side, in letters of a
three inch (3") minimum, the name of the licensee operating it. If more than
one cab is operated by a licensee, each taxicab shall be so designated by a
different number and such number shall also so appear on each side of said cab.
Identification of driver with photograph shall be displayed so that it is
readable from the back seat.
   F.   Insurance: Proof of insurance shall be provided to the chief of police
or his delegate or village treasurer including a three hundred thousand dollar
($300,000.00) liability insurance policy for each vehicle covering liability
for injuries and property damage.
   G.   Accidents: Any time a taxicab is involved in an accident that causes
damages, which may affect the safety of prospective passengers, it must be
taken out of service immediately and repaired by an ASE certified technician.
   H.   Taxicab Stands: The chief of police shall have the authority to create
on public property, and with the permission of the owner, on business property,
taxicab stands where cabs licensed by the village may wait for passengers.
   I.   Posting Rates Of Fare: There shall be affixed on the inside or outside
of each taxicab in a conspicuous place and in the manner that the same may be
easily and conveniently read by any passenger, a card upon which shall be
printed in plain legible type, the rates of the fare provided for in this
chapter and filed with the village.
   J.   Name And Number On Cabs: Every taxicab, when being operated or when
waiting or standing for use on any street or other public place during the
nighttime, shall have conspicuously painted on either side thereof and on the
rear in distinct and legible letters and figures at least three inches (3") in
length, the number of the village license of the vehicle, preceded by the name
of cab or cab company so placed that the word and number may be distinctly seen
from the outside of the taxicab.
   K.   Application Of Provisions: The provision of this chapter shall not
prevent taxicabs, livery vehicles or public transportation vehicles licensed by
other municipalities from entering the village for the purpose of depositing
passengers who were legally picked up outside the village. The provisions of
this chapter shall not apply to taxicabs, livery vehicles or public
transportation vehicles, which do not stop within the village for the purpose
of picking up or depositing passengers.
   L.   Telephone Service: Every taxicab service, which is licensed by the
village, shall keep in operation at all times regular telephone service so that
a person desiring to hire a public passenger vehicle may call the taxicab. The
owner of the taxicab service will list the telephone number in the local and
regional telephone directories, which are published for the village by the
telephone company, which furnishes local telephone service. (Ord. 2002-23, 5-
14-2002)
3-7-6: SECURITY FOR PROPERTY DAMAGE:
   A.   No license to operate any taxicab within the village shall be issued
unless the applicant for the license shall have on file with the village
treasurer, and in effect, a bond of the taxicab operator with responsible
surety to be approved by the village in the sum of five thousand dollars
($5,000.00), conditioned to pay all expenses incurred by the village in
enforcing the terms of this chapter against the operator, including, but not
limited to, expenses of inspection, testing, towing and removal from service.
   B.   If a taxicab operator fails for a period of thirty (30) days to satisfy
any final judgment against him which resulted from the negligent operation of a
taxicab, and the village treasurer is furnished with a certificate to that
effect from any clerk of a court of record where the judgment was obtained, the
village treasurer shall suspend the operator's license to operate taxicabs in
the village until the judgment is satisfied. (Ord. 2002-23, 5-14-2002)
3-7-7: UNLAWFUL USE:
It shall be unlawful to knowingly permit any taxicab to be used in the
perpetration of a crime or misdemeanor. (Ord. 2002-23, 5-14-2002)
3-7-8: PASSENGERS:
   A.   Duty To Accept: It shall be the duty of the driver of any taxicab to
accept as a passenger any person who seeks to use the taxicab, provided such
person is not intoxicated and conducts himself in an orderly manner. No person
shall be admitted to a taxicab that is already occupied without the consent of
the passenger therein.
   B.   Direct Route: The driver shall proceed to the destination by the most
direct available route from the place where the passenger enters the cab.
   C.   Rates; Meters: No taxicab shall be operated unless it is equipped with
a meter in good condition to record the amount to be charged on each trip,
which amount shall be shown in figures visible to the passenger. Upon request,
each passenger shall be given a receipt showing the amount so paid and the name
of the company or person operating the cab together with the number of the cab
if such company or person operates more than one taxicab in the village.
   D.   Continuous Service To Be Provided: Every person licensed to operate
taxicabs on streets of the village shall furnish twenty four (24) hour service
to the public, together with a central telephone location and an attendant.
   E.   Prompt Service: Every taxicab service which is licensed by the village
shall answer all calls received for service within the village as soon as
possible. If service cannot be rendered the service will notify the customer of
such and give the reason(s) for the delay. It shall be unlawful for any taxicab
service, which is licensed by the village to refuse to accept a request for
service anywhere within the village at any time vehicles are available for
service. (Ord. 2002-23, 5-14-2002)
3-7-9: VIOLATIONS:
   A.   No taxicab shall be operated until its taximeter is tested and
certified to be accurate and sealed.
   B.   The taximeter shall be located so that its face can be seen by any
passenger riding in the taxicab.
   C.   Adequate illumination shall be provided for the face of the taximeter
so that it may be read by the passenger whenever the vehicle is in operation.
   D.   No person operating or owning any taxicab shall transfer any taximeter
to any other vehicle unless the meter is inspected, reprogrammed and certified
at a taximeter testing center.
   E.   If a taxicab has performed on or changes made to the transmission, any
drive train component, or the size of the tire, the owner of the taxicab must
have the taximeter inspected, reprogrammed and certified at a taximeter testing
center.
   F.   There shall be programmed into the meter of any taxicab licensed in the
village only one rate of fare. The rates shall conform to the provisions in
subsection
3-7-4F of this chapter.
   G.   It shall be unlawful to have in any taxicab more than one taximeter.
   H.   It shall be unlawful to attempt to remove, tamper with or alter a
taximeter seal.
   I.   Any person convicted of tampering with or otherwise manipulating a
taximeter and any person found to have tampered with a taximeter seal or found
with a fraudulently obtained taximeter seal will be subject to a two hundred
fifty dollar ($250.00) fine for the first offense. A five hundred dollar
($500.00) fine will be assessed for the second offense. In addition, the public
passenger vehicle driver/operator registration of such person will be revoked
for a second offense.
   J.   It shall be unlawful for any holder of a taxicab operator's license to
knowingly allow or encourage a driver working for that company to operate a
taxicab that is in violation of any provision of this section.
   K.   The chief of police shall have the authority to require that a
taximeter be recertified and resealed at operator's cost at any time the chief
has reason to believe that the taximeter may not be accurate or that there may
have been tampering with or an unauthorized adjustment made to the taximeter.
   L.   Any taxicab which has a taximeter found to be in violation of any
provisions of this section may be immediately removed from service.
   M.   It is unlawful for any taxicab operator or company to use a radio
frequency scanning type radio to monitor the radio frequency of a competing
company for the purpose of stealing fare of the scanned company.
   N.   It is unlawful for any person, firm or corporation licensed under the
provisions of this chapter to conspire among themselves or with other persons
to fix or control rates for taxicabs within the village. It is the purpose of
this chapter to provide for free and uncontrolled rates. Any scheme, device or
other subterfuge employed by any person to evade this purpose shall be deemed
to be in violation of this chapter and grounds for revocation of the license.
(Ord. 2002-23, 5-14-2002)
3-7-10: PARKING AND CABSTANDS:
The annual fee shall include the right to use one or more of the designated
parking places for taxicabs in each of the various locations throughout the
village, known as "cabstands or taxi stands". Said parking places shall be
assigned by the chief of police or his delegate and no other motor vehicles
shall use that parking place or places. Each cabstand shall be appropriately
parked by signs erected under the supervision of the chief of police or his
delegate. It shall be unlawful to park any vehicle other than a taxicab in any
cabstand.
   A.   Rules of conduct at taxi stands shall include, but are not limited to,
the following:
      1.   Taxicabs entering a taxicab stand or line shall take the rear
positions. Overcrowding cabstands or lines is prohibited.
      2.   While taxicabs occupy designated taxicab stands, no other taxicab
shall bypass the cab line and accept passengers for services unless payment is
to be made by a third party through use of a voucher.
      3.   The first taxicab in line shall be eligible for the first available
fare, unless a passenger indicates a preference for another cab in that line.
      4.   No taxicab shall accept a load along side of, in front of, or
adjacent to an established occupied taxicab stand.
      5.   Cab/taxi drivers shall not sleep while posted in a cabstand.
      6.   There shall be no more than two (2) occupants in any vehicle posted
at a cabstand.
      7.   The driver of any taxicab, while posted at any location in the
village awaiting a fare shall remain in or in close proximity to the vehicle he
is operating. He or she may not leave his or her vehicle unattended for an
unreasonable period of time. (Ord. 2002-23, 5-14-2002)
3-7-11: SUSPENSION OR REVOCATION OF LICENSES:
   A.   If a licensee violates any of the provisions hereof or violates while
in the village any law of the state of Illinois regulating the operation of any
vehicle, or commits any other act or omission which may constitute a nuisance
in fact or a clear and present danger to the public health, safety or general
welfare, then upon notice of the violation from the chief of police or his
designee to the village president, the village president may suspend or revoke
any license issued hereunder utilizing the procedure set forth in section
3-1-12 of this title.
   B.   If any taxicab becomes unsafe for the transportation of passengers or
becomes unclean or not of good appearance the license of the taxicab may be
suspended by the chief of police until the vehicle and all its appurtenances
are put in fit condition for public use to the satisfaction of the chief of
police.
   C.   When a taxicab is permanently removed from service by the owner, the
taxicab vehicle license issued to that vehicle must be immediately surrendered
to the village board or their designee. (Ord. 2002-23, 5-14-2002)
3-7-12: PENALTY:
   A.   Any person who violates, disobeys, omits, neglects or refuses to comply
with or resists the enforcement of any of the provisions of this chapter shall
be fined not less than fifty dollars ($50.00) nor more than seven hundred fifty
dollars ($750.00) for each offense. Each and every violation under this chapter
shall be considered as a separate offense.
   B.   Nothing in this chapter shall be construed as the granting of a vested
or exclusive right to any licensee to engage in the business of operating
taxicabs within the village. Every license hereunder shall be regarded only as
a privilege which is afforded the person or corporation to whom it is issued
and which may be modified, suspended, revoked, canceled, invalidated or
otherwise voided by the village at any time. (Ord. 2002-23, 5-14-2002)
CHAPTER 8
GARAGE SALES
SECTION:
3-8-1: Compliance Required
3-8-2: Definition
3-8-3: License Required; Application; Fee
3-8-4: Display Of License
3-8-5: Limitations
3-8-6: Signs
3-8-7: Exempt Sales
3-8-8: Penalty
3-8-1: COMPLIANCE REQUIRED:
No person shall conduct any garage sale in the Village without complying with
the terms and conditions in this Chapter. (Ord. 82-19, 8-16-1982)
3-8-2: DEFINITION:
For purposes of this Chapter, the term "garage sale" shall mean and include all
sales of tangible personal property conducted on premises in the Village that
are zoned for residential use, regardless of the name by which such sale may be
called. (Ord. 82-19, 8-16-1982)
3-8-3: LICENSE REQUIRED; APPLICATION; FEE:
   A.   Any person seeking to conduct a garage sale in the Village shall obtain
a garage sale license from the Village and in applying for the license shall
furnish the following information:
      1.   Name of the person, firm, group, corporation, association or
organization conducting the said sale.
      2.   The address at which said sale is to be conducted.
      3.   The number of days of the proposed sale.
      4.   The date on which the licensee last applied for a garage sale
license.
      5.   The last two (2) previous dates on which a garage sale was conducted
at the same address.
      6.   A statement that the person, firm or corporation conducting said
sale is the owner or lessee of the premises on which the sale is to be
conducted.
      7.   Whether or not the applicant has been issued any other vendor's
license by any local, State or Federal agency.
      8.   A sworn statement or affirmation by the person signing that the
information therein given is full and true and known to him to be so.
   B.   Upon compliance with the conditions hereof and the payment of the five
dollar ($5.00) license fee, the Village shall issue the license. (Ord. 82-19,
8-16-1982)
3-8-4: DISPLAY OF LICENSE:
Each garage sale license issued shall be prominently displayed on the premises
upon which the garage sale is conducted throughout the entire period of the
licensed sale. (Ord. 82-19, 8-16-1982)
3-8-5: LIMITATIONS:
   A.   Not more than two (2) garage sales shall be conducted on the same
premises by the same household within any twelve (12) month period, nor more
than one sale within any seven (7) day period. No person shall conduct any
garage sale on premises not owned or leased by such person.
   B.   No garage sale shall be conducted over a period of more than three (3)
consecutive calendar days, nor shall any such sale begin before nine o'clock
(9:00) A.M. or continue later than sunset on any given day. (Ord. 82-19, 8-16-
1982)
3-8-6: SIGNS:
Any person licensed under the provisions of this Chapter may erect two (2)
signs advertising the licensed sale providing all such signs conform to the
Village Sign Ordinance and the regulations stated therein. All signs shall be
removed no later than three (3) hours after conclusion of the sale. (Ord. 89-
18, 2-6-1989)
3-8-7: EXEMPT SALES:
The provisions of this Chapter shall not apply to or affect the following
persons or sales:
   A.   Persons selling goods pursuant to an order or process of a court of
competent jurisdiction.
   B.   Persons acting in accordance with their powers and duties as public
officials.
   C.   Any persons selling or advertising for sale an item or items of
personal property which are specifically named or described in the
advertisement and which separate items do not exceed five (5) in number.
   D.   Any sale which falls within the provisions of 815 Illinois Compiled
Statutes 350/1 et seq., as amended.
   E.   Any sale conducted by a charitable or religious organization where the
sale is being held entirely as a fundraising activity for said organization.
(Ord. 82-19, 8-16-1982)
3-8-8: PENALTY:
Any person violating any provision of this Chapter shall be fined not less than
twenty five dollars ($25.00), nor more than five hundred dollars ($500.00).
Each day on which a violation of this Chapter exists or continues shall be
deemed a separate offense. (Ord. 82-19, 8-16-1982)
CHAPTER 9
OFF-TRACK SERVICING AGENCY
SECTION:
3-9-1: Title; Purpose
3-9-2: Definitions
3-9-3: Licensing
3-9-4: Conduct of Business
3-9-5: Supervision of Servicing Agencies
3-9-6: Revocation of License
3-9-7: Penalty
3-9-1: TITLE; PURPOSE:
The name of this Chapter is the FOX LAKE OFF-TRACK SERVICING AGENCIES
ORDINANCE. The purpose is to provide for the licensing and supervision within
the Village of businesses which are conducted, under whatever form, to supply
agents for the lawful purchase of parimutuel tickets for members of the general
public, to the end that such businesses shall be conducted according to those
accounting and business standards which will insure and safeguard the public
safety and welfare.
3-9-2: DEFINITIONS:
   LICENSEE or LICENSED BUSINESS: Any person licensed hereunder to conduct the
business of servicing agency.
   ORIGINAL RECORDS: A. All records as herein defined.
   B.   A daily record of all parimutuel tickets purchased pursuant to orders
recorded on transaction permits (fully identifying such tickets by date, track,
race, selection, predicted finishing position, amount of each such ticket).
   C.   A daily record summarizing by transaction permit number in numerical
sequence the specific amounts owing to customers holding originals of the
transaction permits, setting forth the amount due the holder of each such
original transaction permit.
   PERSON: Any individual, corporation, co-partnership, trust, firm, or any
other business entity.
   SERVICING AGENCY: Any person or any other business entity which, for a
consideration, agrees with another to act as his agent or to supply him with an
agent to purchase parimutuel tickets for him and to return to him either such
tickets so purchased or the redemption value of the tickets so purchased.
   SOURCE RECORDS: All unused transaction permits, copies of all used
transaction permits, all used original transaction permits returned to a
licensed business for redemption thereunder and all losing or unredeemable
parimutuel tickets whose order by customers is recorded on the copies of the
transaction permits relating to such orders.
   TRANSACTION: Any single agreement and transfer of consideration between a
servicing agency and another, whereby the servicing agency agrees to buy, and
to return or redeem one or more specified parimutuel tickets for another. (Ord.
81-12, 4-20-81)
   TRANSACTION PERMIT: Any serially numbered document or form issued by the
Village Treasurer authorizing and permitting the licensed business to enter
into the particular transaction to be recorded on that form.
3-9-3: LICENSING:
   A.   Required: No person shall conduct the business of servicing agency
without first being licensed to do so, making application for such license on a
form adopted by the Village Treasurer. (Ord. 81-12, 4-20-81; amd. 89-34, 2-6-
89)
   B.   License Term and Fee: The term of licenses issued hereunder shall be
from January 1 through December 31 of each year, and the yearly licensing fee
shall be two thousand dollars ($2,000.00). There shall be a maximum of one
license issued pursuant to this Chapter.
   C.   Persons Ineligible:
      1.   No person shall be issued a license hereunder who has, within the
seven (7) years preceding application for license, been convicted of any felony
in violation of the laws of the State, or of the United States, or of any of
the criminal laws of either in which gambling was an element of the offense
charged. If applicant is not an individual, than no officer, director or other
principal of such business shall have been so convicted.
      2.   No person previously engaged in the business of servicing agency in
the State nor any business entity so engaged shall be licensed hereunder, if,
during the ninety (90) day period preceding application, such person or
business entity failed to maintain original records as defined herein,
substantially as required by this Chapter. If such applicant shall have
conducted business for less than ninety (90) days, then applicant shall not be
licensed unless records were so kept and maintained during the period of
operation of the business.
3-9-4: CONDUCT OF BUSINESS:
   A.   Conduct of Business, General: All licensees shall conduct the business
of servicing agency by:
      1.   Accepting orders for the purchase of parimutuel tickets to licensed
Illinois race tracks only. (Ord. 81-12, 4-20-81)
      2.   Entering each such order on a transaction permit previously obtained
from the Village Treasurer. (Ord. 81-12, 4-20-81; amd. Ord. 89-34, 2-6-89)
      3.   Transmission of such orders to the appropriate race track for the
purchase of parimutuel tickets pursuant to such orders.
      4.   Returning all funds to customers due and owing to them on account of
winning tickets purchased for them, or money due them owing to defaulted
purchase, whether or not such default in performance was caused by late scratch
of the customer's selection or any other reason.
      5.   Maintaining a constant audit of all such transactions and events
such as to admit the convenient, efficient, and precise inspection and auditing
of such servicing agency by the Village or other interested or authorized
governmental authority. (Ord. 81-12, 4-20-81)
   B.   Transaction Permits:
      1.   No person shall enter into any transaction as herein defined, except
by recording that transaction in duplicate upon a serially-numbered document
bearing the business name of the licensee as it appears on the license, and
bearing a legend over the seal of the Village Treasurer memorializing the fact
that the Village has been paid a fee of twenty five cents (25¢) for the
issuance of such permit.
      2.   Permits will be ordered through the Village Treasurer for which
licensee shall pre-pay the printing cost, on forms prepared by the Village
Treasurer, except that in recording a transaction thereon, the licensee shall
record the selection made by his customer, the amount of the transaction and
any service charge made by the licensee to his customer.
      3.   Licensee will be permitted to obtain such forms from the Village
Treasurer in any numbers desired by tendering the Treasurer the permit fee of
twenty five cents (25¢) per form obtained from the Treasurer. It will be the
responsibility of licensee to order forms in advance and no form other than
that described and so obtained will be employed to record a transaction.
      4.   On issuing transaction permits, the Treasurer will record the serial
numbers of the forms obtained by the licensee, which shall be issued to
licensee serially in their natural numerical sequence. In using such forms to
record transaction, licensees will, to the extent practicable, use them
according to the same sequence. (Ord. 81-12, 4-20-81; amd. Ord. 89-34, 2-6-89)
3-9-5: SUPERVISION OF SERVICING AGENCIES:
   A.   Inspection: The Chief of Police, or any police officers designated by
him, shall be charged with the inspection of licensed premises. It is the
intent of this Chapter that such premises and all parts thereof shall be
available to such inspection at any reasonable time, provided only that such
inspection will not be of such nature or at such time as to impede the orderly
conduct of business upon the premises in which the business is conducted.
   B.   Bond: Every servicing agency shall be bonded in the sum of twenty
thousand dollars ($20,000.00) payable to the Village to secure the Village from
the expense of auditing where licensee fails to maintain proper records, or so
maintains them that audit is needed to determine if such records as are
required hereby have, in fact, been maintained; provided that, no recovery
shall be had which exceeds the actual cost of audit.
3-9-6: REVOCATION OF LICENSE:
   A.   Agency's Grounds: The license of a servicing agency shall be revoked,
if such agency:
      1.   Permits gambling of any kind to occur upon its business premises,
including bets or wagers on horse races.
      2.   Refuses admission to inspection by a duly authorized representative
of the Village or Chief of Police.
      3.   Having failed to maintain the records required by this Chapter,
fails, within a period of seven (7) days to cure the default, unless such
licensee, its agents, servants, and employees be wholly without fault both as
to the original default and as to the failure to rectify it.
      4.   Fails to record a transaction upon an official transaction permit,
